member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OUTP.GetOUTPOutpostCmdlet
member.summary: Gets information about the specified Outpost.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OUTP.GetOUTPOutpostCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Outpost'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Outposts.Model.GetOutpostResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Outposts.Model.GetOutpostResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OUTP.GetOUTPOutpostCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the OutpostId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^OutpostId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OUTP.GetOUTPOutpostInstanceTypeCmdlet
member.summary:
Lists the instance types for the specified Outpost.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.
The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.
The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OUTP.GetOUTPOutpostInstanceTypeCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'InstanceTypes'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Outposts.Model.GetOutpostInstanceTypesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Outposts.Model.GetOutpostInstanceTypesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OUTP.GetOUTPOutpostInstanceTypeCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the OutpostId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^OutpostId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OUTP.GetOUTPOutpostInstanceTypeCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OUTP.GetOUTPOutpostListCmdlet

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OUTP.NewOUTPOutpostCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the SiteId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^SiteId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OUTP.NewOUTPOutpostCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.OUTP.RemoveOUTPOutpostCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Outposts.Model.DeleteOutpostResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
